intro: Senecio stipellatus, commonly known as the Cape snowflake, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, white to pale blue flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal or mountainous regions. Its leaves are usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers that form dense clusters. Senecio stipellatus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
